title: 112_hr531
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2011" establishes the Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under Subpart XIII of the Public Health Service Act. This program aims to provide loan repayment for frontline health care providers. The Secretary will establish the Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program, where the individual agrees to serve as a health professional for at least 2 years in a frontline care scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayments. To be eligible, an individual must submit an application and sign a written contract. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to submit an application and sign a contract approved by the Secretary. Preference is given to those with interdisciplinary training. The Secretary determines scarcity areas for contract recipients. The Secretary determines scarcity areas for contract recipients under the Loan Repayment Program, giving preference to those with interdisciplinary training. Written notice is provided upon approval of participation in the program. The contract is a written agreement between the Secretary and an individual for student loan repayment. The Secretary determines scarcity areas for contract recipients under the Loan Repayment Program, giving preference to those with interdisciplinary training. Written notice is provided upon approval of participation in the program. The individual with student loan repayment agrees to provide frontline care services for a period of full-time service of not less than 2 years at a health care facility serving a frontline care scarcity area. The Secretary determines scarcity areas for contract recipients under the Loan Repayment Program, giving preference to those with interdisciplinary training. Written notice is provided upon approval of participation in the program. The individual with student loan repayment agrees to provide frontline care services for a period of full-time service of not less than 2 years at a health care facility serving a frontline care scarcity area. The amount of an annual student loan repayment under this section on behalf of an individual shall be determined by the Secretary, taking into consideration the need to recruit health care providers into the loan repayment program. The Secretary may contract with an individual's loan provider for the payment of student loan repayments. If an individual breaches the contract by not fulfilling their service obligation, the United States can recover the total amount paid under the contract plus interest. The term 'frontline care scarcity area' refers to an area, population group, or facility designated as a health professional shortage area or by the State as lacking frontline care services. Frontline care services include various healthcare fields such as general surgery, optometry, physical therapy, and radiologic technology. The loan repayment program for healthcare professionals in frontline care scarcity areas must be implemented within 180 days of enactment. Eligible providers include general surgeons, optometrists, physical therapists, radiologic technologists, and other healthcare professionals who have completed an accredited program in the United States.
